channel.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
channel.description:
Hi guys, I'm new to the RSPS development scene, but I do have some experience with Java coding, I even have a textbook on it.
So, I am going to go hard on starting a RSPS server with 2.0ish exp rates for me and like 8 other friends, we want to play runescape free, and very tightknit. I wanted to make a 317 era server, but I want to recreate runescape exactly like it was during this time, and AFTER everything is like it should be and working, work on optional custom content.
This being my first time, and I do know the no spoonfeeding rule here, I'm wondering where I should start, I've been looking around for 317 source/clients for a few days now but they are all custom content and I want to be as vanilla as vanilla gets. And also, if there was already a source/client like this that I simply haven't found.
Yes, I know the big task that this is, and I am ready for a challenge. I love runescape, but not really what it has become as of lately. So, any tips for a newcomer? I've poked around in guides but they are pretty damn outdated. I honestly don't have much of an idea where I would 'begin' coding. Thanks for any posts! Will have decent response time!

item.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“artem543, post:7, topic:538842”]I love you! Finally, an smart person. Not some ‘leecher’ who is hosting the whole download section up. I do appreciate this kind of posts.

Let me present myself. My name is Artem. I am probably the best client developer on MPSC. Anyway, I do appreciate your post. You may add me if you have any questions or need any help regarding your development( Skype: artembatutin ).

Regarding your project. I would suggsest you to use my client release. You only have to figure out the packet #71 and you’re good to go. Here is the link: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,657160.0.html

Otherwise, good luck! You wouldn’t believe how my first server looked like back in 2010.[/quote]
looks like we have a

BRAGGER.

hide yo kids hide yo wife!
but yes, use artems client.

Read full topic

I love you! Finally, an smart person. Not some ‘leecher’ who is hosting the whole download section up. I do appreciate this kind of posts.

Regarding your project. I would suggsest you to use my client release. You only have to figure out the packet #71 and you’re good to go. Here is the link: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,657160.0.html

Otherwise, good luck! You wouldn’t believe how my first server looked like back in 2010.

item.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Jacepinked, post:4, topic:538842”]Okay, so have playing around with asteria… how do I get the server actually running to test things? It said to get your own IDE to make a working run.bat and
compile.bat.[/quote]
Go on google search for “eclipse download” when ur at the download page, eclipse IDE for java developers.

Once downloaded, create a new java project and choice asteria. Find a client to use, and click run with in eclipse.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Jacepinked Jacepinked

item.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:2, topic:538842”]First of all, don’t refer to programming/developing as “coding”.

Second, it’s it will take a VERY long time to recreate runescape exactly.

Third, use Asteria, it’s a great base and is almost most of it is documented so it’s VERY user friendly. Great source, although you will have to do a lot yourself, so I hope you’re looking for a learning experience with your mates.[/quote]

here’s the way I’ve always saw that frank:

if it is content being written from scratch THEN it is programming. if it is code being modified or edited in any way, i consider that ‘coding’. just my take on that.

but i do support everything else he has said, asteria does look quite user friendly. good starter base for a learner experience.

edit: wouldnt advise you to learn java primarily from a learner base. learn your basics from java docs, etc., and once youve got the hang on everything, THEN you need to test your hand at asteria.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

First of all, don’t refer to programming/developing as “coding”.

Second, it’s it will take a VERY long time to recreate runescape exactly.

Third, use Asteria, it’s a great base and is almost most of it is documented so it’s VERY user friendly. Great source, although you will have to do a lot yourself, so I hope you’re looking for a learning experience with your mates.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting my first RSPS [317]
item.dc:creator: @Jacepinked Jacepinked
item.description:
@Jacepinked wrote:

Hi guys, I’m new to the RSPS development scene, but I do have some experience with Java coding, I even have a textbook on it.

So, I am going to go hard on starting a RSPS server with 2.0ish exp rates for me and like 8 other friends, we want to play runescape free, and very tightknit. I wanted to make a 317 era server, but I want to recreate runescape exactly like it was during this time, and AFTER everything is like it should be and working, work on optional custom content.

This being my first time, and I do know the no spoonfeeding rule here, I’m wondering where I should start, I’ve been looking around for 317 source/clients for a few days now but they are all custom content and I want to be as vanilla as vanilla gets. And also, if there was already a source/client like this that I simply haven’t found.

Yes, I know the big task that this is, and I am ready for a challenge. I love runescape, but not really what it has become as of lately. So, any tips for a newcomer? I’ve poked around in guides but they are pretty damn outdated. I honestly don’t have much of an idea where I would ‘begin’ coding. Thanks for any posts! Will have decent response time!

Read full topic
